curam.util.persistence.helper
Interface LifecycleStateTransitionEvent<S,L extends Lifecycle<S>>

Type Parameters:
S - The class which communicates the state.
L - The class whose lifecycle is managed by changes to.
All Known Implementing Classes:
LifecycleStateTransitionEventDefaultListener
@Implementable
public interface LifecycleStateTransitionEvent<S,L extends Lifecycle<S>>

The hook points for all state transition events. The interface for a "lifecycle" subject must extend this interface.

Method Summary
 void posttransition(L subject, S oldState, S newState)
          Called after a state transition has occurred.
 boolean pretransition(L subject, S oldState, S newState)
          Called before a state transition is about to occur.
 

Method Detail

posttransition

void posttransition(L subject,
                    S oldState,
                    S newState)
                    throws InformationalException
Called after a state transition has occurred.

Parameters:
subject - The object whose state has changed.
oldState - The state that the object has transitioned from (null if the object has been newly inserted).
newState - The state that the object has transitioned to (as now stored on the database, null if the object has been deleted).
Throws:
InformationalException - if the listener vetoes the transition.

pretransition

boolean pretransition(L subject,
                      S oldState,
                      S newState)
                      throws InformationalException
Called before a state transition is about to occur.

Parameters:
subject - The object whose state is about to change.
oldState - The state that the object is about to transition from (as currently stored on the database, null if the object is about to be inserted).
newState - The state that the object is about to transition to (null if the object is about to be deleted).
Returns:
True if the listener approves the transition to go ahead, false if the listener asks to interrupt the transition.
Throws:
InformationalException - if the listener vetoes the transition.
